translated: Similarly, in Jambudvƒ´pa, the realities of the ·∏åƒÅkinƒ´ and so forth are by means of the twelve realities.

original: de ltar yul dang yul du rang rang gi ye shes dang ldan pa gnyis su med par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni dpa' @151b bo rnams dang lhan cig snyoms par zhugs pa rang bzhin 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyed ces bya ba'i don no //

translated: Thus, in each country, the one who is nondual with his own wisdom is called ‚Äúabiding.‚Äù The meaning of the term is ‚Äúthe one who has entered into union with the heroes, the nature of clear light.‚Äù

analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pas so //

analyzed: des kyang re re zhes bya ba la sogs pas de de bzhin du bshad do //

translated: Now, the teaching of the esoteric instructions called the mantra, consecration, seal, and likewise the meditation on the wisdom-being, etc., the invocation of the wisdom mandala, and the worship of the principal and the mandala is stated

translated: The verse is the acceptance preceded by the verse.üîΩAnd that is stated by the symbolic language, as it is said beginning with ‚Äúand that also,‚Äù etc. for the purpose of the instruction on that.

translated: Between the vajra and the sky means in the interior of the channel of the descent of awakening between the vajra gem and the crow-faced one.

original: 'di'i mun ngag gis zhes bya ba'o //

translated: All of those arise from the gnosis ca·πá·∏çƒÅlƒ´.üîΩThe syllable ya·πÉ is the definitive apprehension.üîΩThe previous one in the center is the complete activity of all, such as purification of the aggregates, elements, and so on.üîΩ

original: rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: rgyas rnams so //

translated: The vajra lord is the vajra that is the entity of the indivisible gnosis. That vajra is the gnosis vajra because it holds the life of all sentient beings and is the lord because it is the refuge.

original: de nyid kyi /
analyzed: de nyid kyi /
translated: That

original: lhan skyes chu ni yongs gang las //
analyzed: lhan skyes chu ni yongs gang las //

translated: Wisdom is connected with the times of the samƒÅdhi of the supreme royal ma·πá·∏çala, preceded by the wisdom being, and here and there, in a scattered way, the pa·πá·∏çitas are confused about the entry.

translated: Thus, in the heart of the principal and all the ma·πá·∏çala members, the pledge beings are just like the wisdom beings and the principal and all the others.

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni ye shes sems dpa' de rnams kyi thugs kar slar yang 'di @152b rnams thams cad la ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sngags rnams kyi gzugs kyis rang rang gi sa bon bsgom par bya ba'ang rung ngo
translated: The so-called samƒÅdhisattva is that gnosis being, and again, at the heart of all of them, it is suitable to meditate on the seed syllables in the form of the mantras that will be explained, the samƒÅdhisattva.

original: // ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams kyi kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pas lhan cig skyes pa'i snying po 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams kyi kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pas lhan cig skyes pa'i snying po 'jig par 'gyur ro //

translated: the dharmakƒÅya of the yogins is the samƒÅdhisattva.üîΩThe sa·πÉbhogakƒÅya is the gnosis being.

original: sprul pa'i sku dam tshig sems dpa' zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku dam tshig sems dpa' zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya is called the commitment being.

analyzed: mngon sum du 'dir de ltar sku 'dis byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is directly perceived here, it is done by this body.

analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de la ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka las 'od zer zhes bya ba ste 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis so //

original: de'i phyir 'chi ba'i mthar ji srid du sna tshogs @153a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'chi ba'i mthar ji srid du sna tshogs @153a * //

analyzed: da ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi thig le'i rnal 'byor dang phra mo'i rnal 'byor te /

analyzed: ltar de rnams su yang rtse mo rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni de de bzhin du bshad pa'o //

analyzed: de rnams su yang thig le rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni re re'i rtse mo la ji lta ba'i rim pas thig le brgya phrag re re mtshon par bya ba'o //

original: de ltar bshad pas sngon du bshad pa rnams kyi snying rje dang byams pa dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin rnal 'byor ma bzhi dang bsres ba'i thams cad gcig tu bsdoms pas stong phrag gcig gis rnal 'byor ma'i tshogs kyi thig le zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: de ltar bshad pas sngon du bshad pa rnams kyi snying rje dang byams pa dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin rnal 'byor ma bzhi dang bsres ba'i thams cad gcig tu bsdoms pas stong phrag gcig gis rnal 'byor ma'i tshogs kyi thig le zhes bya ba'i
translated: Thus, by this explanation, the four yoginis, who are the nature of compassion, love, joy, and equanimity, explained previously, are combined into one, and the total is one thousand, which is the meaning of the ‚Äúbindu of the assembly of yoginis.‚Äù

analyzed: don to // de ltar du ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni du ba la sogs pa'i sbyor bas bcu po rnams kyi rtags re re'i thig le brgya phrag gcig nyid thig le'i gnas rnams su 'bab par bya zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, ‚Äúsmoke and so on‚Äù means that by the yoga of smoke and so on, each of the ten signs is brought to the bindu in the places of the bindus, one hundred times.

analyzed: rdo rje'i phug las mi 'pho ba'i ye shes dpral ba'i dbus rnams su rim pas 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the pristine consciousness that does not move from the vajra palace moves to the forehead and so on in stages.

original: de ltar mdor bsdus pa'i thig le'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: de ltar mdor bsdus pa'i thig le'i rnal 'byor ro //

original: 'dis sems can thams cad kyi 'jig rten par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis sems can thams cad kyi 'jig rten par 'gyur ro //

original: bskal pa sreg pa'i dus rnams su khu tshur gyi mthe bong gi tshad kyi bud med dang skyes pa de @153b rnams thog ma nyid du gcig gi sngon gyi rgyu mtshan gyis bsam gtan dang po'i thog mar 'gyur ro //

original: lus yang ba nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: lus yang ba nyid kyang ngo //

analyzed: de ltar gyur pa dang sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis sgom pa la goms pas lte ba'i gnas rnams su sems brten pa nyid do //
translated: When that happens, by the power of previous aspirations, the mind becomes stable in the navel region through familiarity with meditation.

analyzed: des sems shin gu phra ba'i dngos pos lus yang bar 'gyur ro //

original: rlung bcu rnams su 'dus pas so //
analyzed: rlung bcu rnams su 'dus pas so //

original: gzhan tha mal pa rnams kyi rnam par shes pa song bar gyur pas gzhan gyi 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su las kyi rnam par smin pas las kyi gnas rnams su dmyal ba la sogs par 'tshed pa'am ltung ba'o //

translated: The consciousnesses of other ordinary people have gone, and so they are boiled or fall into the hells and so on in the abodes of karma in other world systems due to the ripening of karma.

original: rnal 'byor goms pa rnams kyis bshad pa'i mtshan nyid kyis thig le 'du shes pas ri rab kyi steng du sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha'i rigs rnams su skye'o //

original: der yang bsam gtan gnyis pa la rang gi lus thim nas 'gro'o //
analyzed: der yang bsam gtan gnyis pa la rang gi lus thim nas 'gro'o //
translated: There, having dissolved one‚Äôs body into the second concentration, one departs.üîΩThe yoga of the subtle

analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams su du ba la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams su bskal pa bsreg par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de nyid phyis stong pa'i dus te phra mo'i rnal 'byor ro //

original: de nas sngags bzlas zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang bcas pas sngags bzlas pa dang bgrang phreng la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //

analyzed: de bzhin du phyed dang bcad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis mchod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

translated: he explains that the worship of the ma·πá·∏çala circle is the worship of the wisdom deities, which are endless and limitless, in the nature of one‚Äôs own world realms, as the agent.

analyzed: ste mchod pa'i lha mo goor'i la sogs pa yang bshad de /
translated: He also explains the goddesses of worship, such as Gaurƒ´, and so forth.

original: ji lta ba'i rim pas goo r'i tsoo r'i bee t'a l'i gh'asma r'i pukka s'i sha ba r'i dmyal ba dang yi dgas dang dud 'gro dang lha dang lha ma yin dang mi rnams te 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: ji lta ba'i rim pas goo r'i tsoo r'i bee t'a l'i gh'asma r'i pukka s'i sha ba r'i dmyal ba dang yi dgas dang dud 'gro dang lha dang lha ma yin dang mi rnams te 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: In the same order, Gaurƒ´, Caurƒ´, VetƒÅlƒ´, Ghasmarƒ´, Pukkasƒ´, ≈öabarƒ´, and Chan·∏çƒÅlƒ´ are the hells, hungry ghosts, animals, gods, demigods, and humans, that is, the desire realm.

original: de ji ltar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ji ltar gsungs pa /

original: de ltar gam ni 'gro ba'i phyir zhu ba'i gzugs nyid pas byang chub kyi sems bud med kyi padma rnams su 'gro ba ni 'dod chags chen pos dmyal ba nyid du 'gro ba ste goor'i'o //

translated: Thus, the bodhicitta, which is the form of the supplicant, goes to the lotuses of the women, that is, to the hells, by means of great passion.

original: de bzhin du yang dag pa'i las rnams su byas pa'i bde ba la sogs pas de 'pho ba na rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi bdag nyid kyis bskyod par gyur pas yi dgas kyi 'gro ba thob pas ni tsoo r'i'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag pa'i las rnams su byas pa'i bde ba la sogs pas de 'pho ba na rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi bdag nyid kyis bskyod par gyur pas yi dgas kyi 'gro ba thob pas ni tsoo r'i'o //
translated: Similarly, when the bodhicitta moves by means of the bliss of the correct rites, etc., it is shaken by its own naturelessness, and thus it attains the state of a hungry ghost, and so it goes to Caurƒ´.üîΩThus, by the knowledge that all those phenomena, such as passion, are inexpressible, it goes directly to the state of the desired destination, and so it goes to Gaurƒ´, the state of a god, by means of the passion of the male voice.

original: de ltar rig pas ma lus pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i chos de dag gis brjod mi nus pas thad kar 'gro bar 'dod pa'i 'gro bar gyur par 'gro ste skyes pa'i skad kyi zhe sdang gis dud 'gro 'thob pas be t'a lde de bzhin du steng du
analyzed: de ltar rig pas ma lus pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i chos de dag gis brjod mi nus pas thad kar 'gro bar 'dod pa'i 'gro bar gyur par 'gro ste skyes pa'i skad kyi zhe sdang gis dud 'gro 'thob pas be t'a lde de bzhin du steng du
translated: Similarly, it goes to VetƒÅlƒ´, the state of an animal, by means of the hatred of the male voice.

original: 'gro ba dran nas zag pa med pa nyid dang ldan no //
analyzed: 'gro ba dran nas zag pa med pa nyid dang ldan no //
translated: Thus, it goes to Ghasmarƒ´, the state of a human, by means of the ignorance of the male voice.üîΩThus, it goes to Pukkasƒ´, the state of a demigod, by means of the pride of the male voice.üîΩThus, it goes to Ca·πá·∏çƒÅlƒ´, the state of a god, by means of the jealousy of the male voice.üîΩThus, it goes to ·∏åombinƒ´, the state of a buddha, by means of the upright movement of the wind of the male voice.

original: thar pa'i gzugs kyis ston pa rdo rje'i theg pa la gcig tu gnas pa dpral bar lha'i tshogs kyi gha sma r'i'i 'gro bas 'thob pas so //

translated: The form of liberation is the teaching of the Vajra Vehicle, which is the attainment of the world of Ghasmarƒ´ of the assembly of gods on the forehead.

original: rnam par 'joms te me tog 'dod ma'i rnam par rtog pa rlag par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par 'joms te me tog 'dod ma'i rnam par rtog pa rlag par byed do //
translated: It is the total destruction, the destruction of the thought of the flower of desire.

original: des kun nas 'dzin pa la dga' ba la 'dus pa dang ldan pas pukka s'i lha ma yin gyi 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: des kun nas 'dzin pa la dga' ba la 'dus pa dang ldan pas pukka s'i lha ma yin gyi 'gro ba'o //

translated: The delight in the call is the form of the bindu of the mahƒÅmudrƒÅ free from parts, which is the absence of the mind of the water of the rabbit holder, which is the attainment of the world of the great delusion of ≈öƒÅvarƒ´.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi rnal 'byor ma mchod pa'i thig le zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi rnal 'byor ma mchod pa'i thig le zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the bindu of the worship of the yoginƒ´s of the desire realm.

original: de bzhin du g-yo ba nyid kyis dang mkha' 'gro chen po thim par gyur pas mchog tu bde ba rnams su thig le gzugs ster ba mo @154b lha rnams kyi ste 'di nyid ltar rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yo ba nyid kyis dang mkha' 'gro chen po thim par gyur pas mchog tu bde ba rnams su thig le gzugs ster ba mo @154b lha rnams kyi ste 'di nyid ltar rtogs par byed do //
translated: Likewise, by the movement of the great sky-farers dissolving into the supreme bliss, the form of the drop is given to the goddesses.

original: tsandal'i gzugs khams ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tsandal'i gzugs khams ma zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The form of the candali is called the ‚Äúelemental mother.‚Äù

original: don dam pa de shar bas dbang phyug gi spyod yul gyi sems de nyid da rgyal tsheb dbang phyug gi gzugs kyis phal ba dang gtso bor 'dod pa ni dombin'i'o //

translated: By the arising of that ultimate, the mind, which is the domain of the lord, is the lord himself. When it is victorious, the form of the lord is asserted to be the common and the principal.

analyzed: gzugs med 'gro ba'i gzugs can ma'o //

analyzed: de ltar ma lus pa khams gsum pa'i rnam pa dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo mchod pa'i bdag nyid du gsungs pa /

analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi dngos po thams cad de theg pa chen po la sogs pa'i gzugs can no //

analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa / kun rdzob dang ni don dam pa //

analyzed: de ltar mdor bstan pa'i rgyas par bshad pa gsungs pa /

original: 'di ltar he ni sems bdag nyid rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni sems kyis yongs su bsgoms pa'i rnal 'byor gzhom du med pa'i sems kyi rgyus rang nyid 'jig rten la gnas nas mtho ris kyi 'jig rten te rang 'byung gi ye shes zhes ba ba'i don to
analyzed: 'di ltar he ni sems bdag nyid rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni sems kyis yongs su bsgoms pa'i rnal 'byor gzhom du med pa'i sems kyi rgyus rang nyid 'jig rten la gnas nas mtho ris kyi 'jig rten te rang 'byung gi ye shes zhes ba ba'i don to
translated: Thus, he is the yoga of the nature of mind, and by the cause of the invincible mind, he himself, abiding in the world, is the world of the higher realms, that is, the meaning of the term self-arisen pristine consciousness.

original: // slar yang ru ni ngag bdag nyid //
analyzed: // slar yang ru ni ngag bdag nyid //

analyzed: ces bya ba ni slar yang gi sgras rnal 'byor ston pa'i tshig go //

analyzed: lus kyi rang bzhin sbyor bdag nyid //

analyzed: ces bya ba ste lus rnams su bzung ba'i rnal 'byor ni mchog tu gnyis su med pa'i rgyu can la ste /

analyzed: sa 'og gi 'jig rten rnams su phyogs rnams kyis gnas la lta bas so //

original: de ltar mdor na sgom pa po'i bdag nyid kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi 'pho ba med pa'i bde ba de'i dbus su sems la sogs pa'i khams gsum thim pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mdor na sgom pa po'i bdag nyid kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi 'pho ba med pa'i bde ba de'i dbus su sems la sogs pa'i khams gsum thim pa'o //
translated: In brief, in the middle of that bliss without emission of the yogi/nƒ´, the meditator, the three realms of mind and so on dissolve.

original: gang gi phyid de'i bde ba ni lus ngag yid kyi rang bzhin gyi sa 'og sa steng ma tho ris kyi 'jig rten can te de'i phyir bde ba'i thog mtha' dbus su ni zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi yi ge rnams kyis bsrung bar bya ste //
analyzed: gang gi phyid de'i bde ba ni lus ngag yid kyi rang bzhin gyi sa 'og sa steng ma tho ris kyi 'jig rten can te de'i phyir bde ba'i thog mtha' dbus su ni zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi yi ge rnams kyis bsrung bar bya ste //
translated: Since that bliss is the nature of body, speech, and mind, it is the worlds of the underworld, earth, and heaven. Therefore, the beginning, end, and middle of bliss is protected by the mantra syllables.

analyzed: de yi sngags kyi yi ge rnams gsungs pa /

original: boo shata he zhes bya ba ste thog mar bde ba skye ba'i dus su rab tu 'bab pa nyid kyi phyir boo zhes bya ba ni khyab pa'i sbyor bas 'bab pas so //
analyzed: boo shata he zhes bya ba ste thog mar bde ba skye ba'i dus su rab tu 'bab pa nyid kyi phyir boo zhes bya ba ni khyab pa'i sbyor bas 'bab pas so //
translated: The word bho·∏• is the time of the arising of bliss at the beginning, because it is the falling of the downward-voiding [wind].

original: de bzhin du dbus su bde ba dal so ba'i dus su /
analyzed: de bzhin du dbus su bde ba dal so ba'i dus su /

analyzed: dbus ma rab tu zhi ba nyid kyis shata zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i dngos po'i rnam pa dang bral ba'o //

analyzed: 'gro ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin yid mi g-yo bas na shata zhes bya ba'o //

original: de bzhin du khams de nyid de'i nang du son pa'i bde ba'i bde ba de rnam par nyams pa srung ba'i phyir he zhes @179a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams de nyid de'i nang du son pa'i bde ba'i bde ba de rnam par nyams pa srung ba'i phyir he zhes @179a * //

analyzed: bya'o ; / brjod pa he'i rnam pas srog gi rlung rnam par bzung bas so //

original: de ltar yi ge gsum po nges lte ba'i 'og gi rtsa gsum steng du kha bltas pa rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar yi ge gsum po nges lte ba'i 'og gi rtsa gsum steng du kha bltas pa rnams so //

original: de bzhin du 'og tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og tu 'gyur ro //

original: yi ge gnyis ni bu ga gnyis su ste /
analyzed: yi ge gnyis ni bu ga gnyis su ste /
translated: The two syllables are in the two holes.

original: de ltar hrem gi yi ge ni steng du'o /
analyzed: de ltar hrem gi yi ge ni steng du'o /
translated: Thus, the syllable hre·πÅ is above,

original: hrim gi yi ge ni 'og tu'o //
analyzed: hrim gi yi ge ni 'og tu'o //

original: srog gi rlung gi bskyod bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: srog gi rlung gi bskyod bzhin pa'o //

original: de yang der bskyod par bya ste dbu ma'i dbus su dgug pa'o //
analyzed: de yang der bskyod par bya ste dbu ma'i dbus su dgug pa'o //
translated: And they are to be moved there, drawn into the middle of the central channel.

original: de ltar 'di yi btang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bla ma'i gdams ngag gis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'di yi btang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bla ma'i gdams ngag gis shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúits emission‚Äù and so forth should be understood by the instructions of the guru.

analyzed: de'i dus su zhes bya ba ni bum pa can gyi nang du thim pa'i skad cig gi 'khor lo de la de skad bshad do //
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time‚Äù refers to the wheel of the moment of dissolution into the vase.

analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas dus tshod bzhi rnams kyang /

analyzed: bde ba'i thog ma'i sa bon can gyi bar ni rtsod pa'i dus kyi'o //
translated: The period of the first part of the night is the period of the seed of bliss.

analyzed: de bzhin du hrom zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnyis ldan no //
translated: Similarly, ‚Äúhrom‚Äù and so forth explain the period of the two.

original: de ltar btang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsum ldan no //
analyzed: de ltar btang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsum ldan no //
translated: Thus, having sent and so forth are the three-quarter period.

analyzed: de'i dus zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdzogs ldan gyi gnas skabs te rim pa ji lta bas so //
translated: The time of that and so forth are the perfect period, in the same order.

original: sngags des de bzhin zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi rnam par gzhag pa ste boo shata rtsod dus so //üîΩhe gnyis ldan no //
analyzed: sngags des de bzhin zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi rnam par gzhag pa ste boo shata rtsod dus so // he gnyis ldan no //
translated: By that mantra, thus and so forth are the arrangement of the mantra: bho·∏• is the age of strife.üîΩHe is the third-quarter period.

original: hrem gsum ldan no //
analyzed: hrem gsum ldan no //
translated: Hre·∏• is the second-quarter period.

original: hrim rdzogs ldan no //
analyzed: hrim rdzogs ldan no //
translated: Hri·∏• is the perfect period.

original: mchod pa zhes bya ba ni btang ba'o //
analyzed: mchod pa zhes bya ba ni btang ba'o //
translated: Worship is having sent.

original: mchog tu rmad du byung ba zhes bya ba ni drug pa'i don du thog ma ste de'i phyir sems kyi mchog tu rmad du byung ba'i mchod pa rdo rje 'chang gi bdag nyid can gyi zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: mchog tu rmad du byung ba zhes bya ba ni drug pa'i don du thog ma ste de'i phyir sems kyi mchog tu rmad du byung ba'i mchod pa rdo rje 'chang gi bdag nyid can gyi zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The supreme marvel is the first of the sixth case, and therefore the thought is that the supreme marvel of the mind is the worship of the nature of Vajradhara.

original: de ltar rnam shes brgyad rnams kyis //
analyzed: de ltar rnam shes brgyad rnams kyis //
translated: Thus, by the eight consciousnesses,

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gcig ces bya ba ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i'o //

original: gnyis zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi'o //
analyzed: gnyis zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi'o //
translated: The two is the afflicted mind.

original: gsum zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i'o //
analyzed: gsum zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i'o //
translated: The three are of the mental consciousness.

original: lnga zhes bya ba ni mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa rnams kyi ste 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: lnga zhes bya ba ni mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa rnams kyi ste 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can rnams kyi'o //
translated: The five are of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body consciousnesses, which have the characteristic of engagement.

original: le'u bzhi pa'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni go cha'i srung ba'i le'u bzhi ste dang po bcu bdun pa nas nyi shu pa 'di'i bar du rim pa ji lta bas kun gzhi la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: le'u bzhi pa'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni go cha'i srung ba'i le'u bzhi ste dang po bcu bdun pa nas nyi shu pa 'di'i bar du rim pa ji lta bas kun gzhi la sogs pa ste /
translated: By the application of the fourth chapter, the fourth chapter is the armor protection chapter. From the seventeenth up to this twentieth chapter, in order, are the foundation consciousness, etc.

original: rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs par @179b bya ba ste de rnams kyi bskyed pa bzang po nyid du bya ba'am sangs rgyas kyi gzugs rnams so //
analyzed: rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs par @179b bya ba ste de rnams kyi bskyed pa bzang po nyid du bya ba'am sangs rgyas kyi gzugs rnams so //
translated: The realization is what is to be realized, which is to be generated well, or the forms of the buddhas.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated.

original: spyod pa zhes bya ba ni spyod pa'i rgyud rnams te gsum pa zhes bya ba ni bcu dgu pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa zhes bya ba ni spyod pa'i rgyud rnams te gsum pa zhes bya ba ni bcu dgu pa'o //
translated: The conduct is the conduct tantras. The third is the nineteenth.

original: de ltar le'u bzhi pa rnams su bya ba ni nyi shu pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar le'u bzhi pa rnams su bya ba ni nyi shu pa'o //
translated: Thus, the application of the four chapters is the twentieth.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud rnams ni sngon du gsungs pa rnams dang de bzhin du 'chad par 'gyur bar bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud rnams ni sngon du gsungs pa rnams dang de bzhin du 'chad par 'gyur bar bshad do //
translated: Likewise, the Yoga and Yogini Tantras are those previously mentioned and those to be explained.

original: de kho na'i gdan zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor gyi gdan dang gsang ba'i gdan te sngar gsungs pa dang lhag ma 'chad pa de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de kho na'i gdan zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor gyi gdan dang gsang ba'i gdan te sngar gsungs pa dang lhag ma 'chad pa de de bzhin no //
translated: The seat of reality is the Yoga seat and the secret seat, as previously mentioned and the remainder to be explained.

original: de ltar srung ba yang zhes bya ba ni rim pa ji lta bas le'u bzhi rnams su lha la sogs pa'i 'gro ba rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar srung ba yang zhes bya ba ni rim pa ji lta bas le'u bzhi rnams su lha la sogs pa'i 'gro ba rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la gzhug pa'o //
translated: Thus, the protection also is as follows: in the four chapters, in the same order, the gods and so on are introduced to the qualities of the Buddha.

original: kun 'gro rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: kun 'gro rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The all-pervading ones are the Bodhisattvas and so on.

original: de ji ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis lam du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de ji ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis lam du 'gro ba'o //
translated: How do they travel the path like the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas?

original: de dang de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni gdan bzhi la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang 'jig rten rnams kyi chos nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni gdan bzhi la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang 'jig rten rnams kyi chos nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: Their nature is that of the Catuspitha and so on, and the nature of the world and so on.

original: bskal pa bzang por bzhugs pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni stong du bzhis ma tshang ba'i byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: bskal pa bzang por bzhugs pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni stong du bzhis ma tshang ba'i byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Those abiding in the fortunate eon refers to the bodhisattvas and so on who are less than a thousand by four.

original: de ji ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pas bskyed ce na gang gi tshe bskal pa bzang po la sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba med ces sngar gsungs pas rang gi tshig dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pas bskyed ce na gang gi tshe bskal pa bzang po la sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba med ces sngar gsungs pas rang gi tshig dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: How do the buddhas, bodhisattvas and so on generate it? Since it was previously stated that buddhas do not appear in the fortunate eon, this contradicts your own words.

original: 'di de'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di de'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig gsungs pa /
translated: The Tathagata spoke these words for this purpose:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgras 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sems can gyi khams dge ba'i las kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgras 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sems can gyi khams dge ba'i las kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
translated: The Tathagata, and so on. Here, the term Tathagata refers to the virtuous karma of sentient beings in the past, future and present, the bodhisattvas.

original: des nye bar spyod pa med pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi 'chi ba la sogs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: des nye bar spyod pa med pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi 'chi ba la sogs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro ;
translated: For those who do not rely on them, the arising of death and so on of the Tathagatas does not occur.

original: / nye bar spyod pa dang bcas pa'i sprul pa rnams kyi sems can gyi khams kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'chi ba la sogs pa yod de de yang 'jig rten pa'i 'du shes tsam du ste don dam par slar yang de med do //
analyzed: / nye bar spyod pa dang bcas pa'i sprul pa rnams kyi sems can gyi khams kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'chi ba la sogs pa yod de de yang 'jig rten pa'i 'du shes tsam du ste don dam par slar yang de med do //
translated: The emanations with enjoyment have the elements of sentient beings, such as birth, etc. , for the bodhisattvas, but that is only a worldly convention, not ultimately, since they are again nonexistent.

original: sgyu ma tsam zhes bya'o //üîΩde'i phyir de ltar sgyu ma'i @180a * //
analyzed: sgyu ma tsam zhes bya'o // de'i phyir de ltar sgyu ma'i @180a * //
translated: They are said to be mere illusion.

original: rang bzhin skyes par son nas 'jug pa med pa rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rgyu zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin skyes par son nas 'jug pa med pa rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rgyu zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, in this way, having attained the nature of illusion, the cause of the engagement of those who are without engagement is so considered.

original: rang gi rang bzhin sems can zhes bya ba ni rang rang gi lhag par mos pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin sems can zhes bya ba ni rang rang gi lhag par mos pa ste /
translated: The nature of sentient beings is the individual inclinations.

original: sna tshogs pa'i sems can gyi bsam pa sna tshogs pa'i rgyud dang sna tshogs pa'i chos bstan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i sems can gyi bsam pa sna tshogs pa'i rgyud dang sna tshogs pa'i chos bstan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The various continuums of sentient beings have various intentions, and the various teachings of the Dharma are for the various continuums of sentient beings.

original: de ltar chos 'di rnams kyi lta ba gzhan yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar chos 'di rnams kyi lta ba gzhan yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, he also speaks of another view of these dharmas:

original: bdun cu rtsa gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdun cu rtsa gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The seventy-two, etc.

original: kun du bskyod ma'i ni las zhes bya ba ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa rang gi sems g-yo ba'i phyir de'i mi g-yo ba nyid kyis dang / las rnams su lung gi sgor bstan pa nyid ni kun bskyod ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: kun du bskyod ma'i ni las zhes bya ba ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa rang gi sems g-yo ba'i phyir de'i mi g-yo ba nyid kyis dang / las rnams su lung gi sgor bstan pa nyid ni kun bskyod ma lta bu'o //
translated: The action of the moving one is the various movements of one's own mind, and the immobility of that is the action of the moving one.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He declares just that:

original: lnga zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste dang po sa nas nam mkha'i mthar zad par rnam pa lnga ni gang nyan thos rnams kyis lta bas so //
analyzed: lnga zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste dang po sa nas nam mkha'i mthar zad par rnam pa lnga ni gang nyan thos rnams kyis lta bas so //
translated: The five and so on. The five aspects from the earth up to space are seen by the Sravakas.

original: de bzhin du 'dul ba dang / mngon pa'i chos dang / mdo sde rnams pa gsum ste gang zag gi yang lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dul ba dang / mngon pa'i chos dang / mdo sde rnams pa gsum ste gang zag gi yang lnga pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the three Dharmas of the Vinaya, Abhidharma, and Sutra are the five aspects of the person.

original: rangs sangs rgyas rnams kyi rang sangs rgyas kyi lta ba gnyis zhes bya ba ni bse ru'i spyod pa dang sder spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rangs sangs rgyas rnams kyi rang sangs rgyas kyi lta ba gnyis zhes bya ba ni bse ru'i spyod pa dang sder spyod pa'o //
translated: The two views of the Pratyekabuddhas are the rhinoceros-like and the group-dwelling.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i bdun zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i bdun zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: The seven of the Yogacarin are the imagined, the dependent, and the absolute.

original: de ltar yang re re la rnam pa gnyis rab tu gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar yang re re la rnam pa gnyis rab tu gsungs te /
translated: Thus, each of these is said to have two aspects.

original: bdun pa 'di rnams kyi byed pas brtags pa mig dang rna ba dag go //
analyzed: bdun pa 'di rnams kyi byed pas brtags pa mig dang rna ba dag go //
translated: The constructed eye and ear are distinguished by their function.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni sna dang lce'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni sna dang lce'o //
translated: The dependent eye and ear are the nose and tongue.

original: yongs su grub pa ni lus dang yid dag ste /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa ni lus dang yid dag ste /

original: tshor ba dang nyon mongs pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang nyon mongs pa de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of feeling and the afflictions.

original: sngon po ser po sogs snang ba //
analyzed: sngon po ser po sogs snang ba //
translated: The appearance of blue, yellow, and so forth

original: brtags pa'i mig tu brjod pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa'i mig tu brjod pa'o //
translated: is said to be the constructed eye.

original: de na rgyun du ma mthong sems //
analyzed: de na rgyun du ma mthong sems //
translated: The mind that does not see that continuously

original: 'phrul pa de ni dbang po ru //
analyzed: 'phrul pa de ni dbang po ru //
translated: is the magical, dependent eye.

original: sgra yi yul du gang shes pa //
analyzed: sgra yi yul du gang shes pa //
translated: The cognition of sound objects

original: rtog pa yis ni brtags pa'o //üîΩde kun song ba'i bdag nyid du //
analyzed: rtog pa yis ni brtags pa'o // de kun song ba'i bdag nyid du //
translated: is the conceptual, constructed ear.üîΩThe mind that is the nature of all that has gone

original: sems ni kun du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: sems ni kun du 'gro ba'o //

original: thams cad rang bzhin bdag med par //
analyzed: thams cad rang bzhin bdag med par //

analyzed: drin ni sa la sogs de bzhin // snom par gyur pa ma byung ba'i //
translated: the nature of earth and so forth is the same.üîΩThe mind that is not the nature of the apprehender

original: bdag nyid sems ni gzhan dbang ngo //
analyzed: bdag nyid sems ni gzhan dbang ngo //
translated: is the dependent nature.

original: khams gsum ro ni myang ba ste //
analyzed: khams gsum ro ni myang ba ste //
translated: The experience of the three realms

original: chos sku bdag nyid chen po 'dzin //
analyzed: chos sku bdag nyid chen po 'dzin //
translated: is the great identity of the dharmakƒÅya.

original: lce ni kun gyi rang bzhin khams //
analyzed: lce ni kun gyi rang bzhin khams //

original: sems ni ye shes dbang can no //
analyzed: sems ni ye shes dbang can no //

original: bde ba sna @180b tshogs rab tu bshad //
analyzed: bde ba sna @180b tshogs rab tu bshad //

original: ro mnyam lha rdzas gnyis su med //
analyzed: ro mnyam lha rdzas gnyis su med //

original: lus kyi dngos po yang dag 'thob //
analyzed: lus kyi dngos po yang dag 'thob //

original: yongs grub rgyud du smra ba'o //üîΩyid ces bya ba thams cad du //
analyzed: yongs grub rgyud du smra ba'o // yid ces bya ba thams cad du //
translated: The perfect is the tantra.üîΩThe mind is called the goer.

original: 'gro ba po gang der 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba po gang der 'gro ba'o //
translated: It goes everywhere.

original: rtog med bdag nyid de yang ni //
analyzed: rtog med bdag nyid de yang ni //
translated: It is also the nature of nonconceptuality.

original: shes bya'i mtshon bya sogs pas mtshon //
analyzed: shes bya'i mtshon bya sogs pas mtshon //

analyzed: de rnams su ni 'byed pa tsam //

analyzed: nyon mongs kyang ni kun phun tshogs //

original: chos dbyings la sogs bdag bdag tu //
analyzed: chos dbyings la sogs bdag bdag tu //

original: rtog pas yid kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rtog pas yid kyi bdag nyid do //

original: de ltar sems rig pa thams cad //
analyzed: de ltar sems rig pa thams cad //

analyzed: de ni dngos med bsam min pa'o //

analyzed: gzhi ni kun gyi bdag nyid do //

original: zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdus pa'o //

analyzed: rgya che ba ni sna tshogs pa'i bstan bcos su go bar bya'o //

analyzed: bdag gis ni gzhung rgya che ba'i 'jigs pas ma bshad do //

analyzed: dbu ma mchog rnams kyi ni brgyad //

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /

original: bye brag smra ba dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa dang / mdo sde pa dang / rtsa ba'i dbu ma pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa dang / dbu ma chen po dang / lta ba thams cad kyi bdag nyid do //

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi bcu drug ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid bcu drug gi dbye bas so //
translated: The adherents of the Perfection Vehicle have sixteen, divided into sixteen emptinesses.

original: gsang sngags theg pa'i sum cu drug / ces bya ba ni khams sum cu rtsa drug byang chub kyi phyogs rnams kyis phye bas so //
analyzed: gsang sngags theg pa'i sum cu drug / ces bya ba ni khams sum cu rtsa drug byang chub kyi phyogs rnams kyis phye bas so //

original: gnyis kyis bdun dang brgyad rnams kyi //
analyzed: gnyis kyis bdun dang brgyad rnams kyi //

original: de ltar thams cad sngags kyi theg pa'o zhes bya ba ni lta ba bdun cu rtsa gnyis po rnams te de de bzhin du gsungs te /

translated: Thus, ‚Äúall is the Mantra Vehicle‚Äù means the seventy-two views, and that is taught thus.

analyzed: rnal 'byor ma dang rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi dbye ba rnams su'o //
translated: In the divisions of the Yoginƒ´ and Yoga Tantras,

original: de'i phyir de ltar bla ma'i drin gyi shes par bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar bla ma'i drin gyi shes par bya zhes bya ba'o //

original: rtsa'i kun spyod rtsa ba can //
analyzed: rtsa'i kun spyod rtsa ba can //

original: zhes bya ba ni rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis rnams kyi rtsa ba ni gtso bo'i rtsa ste bdun cu rtsa gnyis po rtsa stong phrag so so re re yang ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis rnams kyi rtsa ba ni gtso bo'i rtsa ste bdun cu rtsa gnyis po rtsa stong phrag so so re re yang ngo //
translated: The root of the seventy-two thousand channels is the principal channel, and each of the seventy-two thousand channels is also a root.

original: de la 'di rnams thams cad kyang kun du spyod pas aa wa dh'u t'ir gzhug pa dang / der lta ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'di rnams thams cad kyang kun du spyod pas aa wa dh'u t'ir gzhug pa dang / der lta ba'o //
translated: There, all of these are engaged in, and so they are inserted into the avadh≈´tƒ´, and that is seen.

original: ming gis lhag par rtogs pa ni @181a * //
analyzed: ming gis lhag par rtogs pa ni @181a * //

analyzed: bla ma'i man ngag gis shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: is to be known through the guru‚Äôs instruction.üîΩThat is the certainty.

original: de ci'i don du rtsa bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ci'i don du rtsa bar gsungs pa /

original: he ru ka ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas te 'dir rgyud 'di rnams thams cad kyi rtsa ba ni he ru ka nyid de de'i dbye bas rnal 'byor ma dngos su'o zhes bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: he ru ka ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas te 'dir rgyud 'di rnams thams cad kyi rtsa ba ni he ru ka nyid de de'i dbye bas rnal 'byor ma dngos su'o zhes bya ba'i don no //
translated: The meaning is that Heruka and so forth are the root of all these tantras, and that by its divisions, the yoginis are directly [present].

analyzed: de ci ltar sna tshogs pa'i rgyud du gsungs she na gsungs pa /

original: srid dang mya ngan 'das na bzhugs //
analyzed: srid dang mya ngan 'das na bzhugs //

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe he ru ka'i rnam pas srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbus su bzhugs pa de'i tshe srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa nges par ston pa'i don du gsungs pa ste sna tshogs pa nyid do //

translated: When [he] abides in the middle of existence and nirvana by the aspect of Heruka, then for the purpose of teaching existence and nirvana, [he] is said to be various.

translated: Thus, the end of the expressible is not there, in the form of the inseparability of existence and nirvƒÅ·πáa and ≈örƒ´ Heruka, because all the channels are the ≈örƒ´ Heruka of the downward-clearing and rootless, that is, the meaning of ‚Äúrootless.‚Äù

analyzed: le'u nyi shu pa'i bshad pa'o /

translated: The commentary on the great king of tantras of Yoginƒ´, the glorious Ocean of Dakas, called the Ship, has explained the ritual of the unsurpassed enlightenment with the mantras of the armor of protection of the supreme horse and Ca·πá·∏çƒÅlƒ´. This is the explanation of the twenty-second chapter.

original: yang dag rdo rje 'chang phyag 'tshal //

analyzed: nges par gung mo rtse mo zhes bya ba ni gung mo dang ming med dang mthe'u chung gi sor mo gsum gsum rtse mo'i rnam par gzhag par bya ste rim pa ji lta bas 'og dang steng dang lte ba'i dbus las la la n'a dang ra sa n'a
translated: The one called ‚Äúthe tips of the middle fingers‚Äù is the three fingers, the middle, ring, and little fingers, in the form of tips, placed in the lower, upper, and middle navel, respectively, as lalanƒÅ, rasanƒÅ,

translated: and avadh≈´tƒ´.

analyzed: dpral ba'i phyogs su bzhag pa ni sngon du bshad pa'i bcing ba byas pas byang chub kyi sems dpral ba'i dbus su son pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
